article_text:
HCA Holdings Inc. said its first-quarter earnings rose 17% as the hospital operator continued to benefit from rising admissions.

For 2016, the company raised its adjusted per-share earnings estimate by 20 cents a share to between $6.20 and $6.65 to reflect a tax benefit recorded in the first quarter related to an accounting change. HCA also...

article_summary:
HCA Holdings Inc. said its first-quarter earnings rose 17% as the hospital operator continued to benefit from rising admissions.
HCA also...
For 2016, the company raised its adjusted per-share earnings estimate by 20 cents a share to between $6.20 and $6.65 to reflect a tax benefit recorded in the first quarter related to an accounting change.
